definition: Jia Baoyu, male character in The Dream of Red Mansions, in love with his cousin Lin Daiyu 林黛玉 but obliged to marry Xue Baochai 薛寶釵|薛宝钗
merchant/to buy
surname Jia
jewel/gem/treasure/precious
jade

sentences.english: Jia Baoyu reflected the tragic experiences of Cao Xueqin.
sentences.chinese: 賈寶玉體現了曹雪芹的悲劇感受。

sentences.english: Her character is fully revealed through her help to Jia Baoyu and Wang Xifeng.
sentences.chinese: 其對賈寶玉和王熙鳳的救助又顯出她的不凡人格。

sentences.english: Now, let's try to talk about this figure Jia Baoyu typical.
sentences.chinese: 現在，就讓我們試着討論一下賈寶玉這個人物的典型。

definition: Xue Baochai, female character in Dream of Red Mansions, married to Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
Su Manshu (1884-1918), Chinese writer, journalist, Buddhist monk, participant in the revolutionary movement
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
source of calamity (esp. of women)
to console
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
elegant name/honorific
to sneer
